title: Déjà Vu: Assemble Web Apps from Modules
description: Déjà Vu is a free and open-source platform for building web apps. It features a catalog of full-stack functionality and an HTML-like language for assembling web apps using the catalog. With Déjà Vu you can build complex apps fast, without writing any client- or server-side procedural code.

title: CLEVR: Collaborative Learning Environments in Virtual Reality
description: CLEVR aims to create a feasible immersive learning experience. In this project, our team of six developed a VR Game called CellVerse to help teams of high school students learn cell biology.

title: Soft Textiles from 3D Printed Rigid Materials
description: I designed interlocking structures that turns rigid 3D printed materials into soft textiles. I demonstrated my design by creating a vest with soft, 3D-printed decorations.

title: Leiserchess: Competitive Chessbot AI
description: Final project of 6.172: Performance Engineering of Software Systems. In this project, our team of four implemented the fastest chessbot AI in class, which uses open book, bitmaps, alpha-beta pruning and various other performance engineering techniques.

title: Weather App that Uses Texts as Form
description: A weather app that uses the form (shape and interaction) of texts to convey the feeling of the weather. Implemented using p5.js (processing).

title: Catology: a Yellow Page of Cat Species
description: A webpage for cat lovers users to search, filter and learn more about different cat species. Implemented using p5.js (processing).

title: LoneStar: an Environmental Balance Game
description: Final project of 6.073: Game Development. The player needs to survive on a planet while balancing among power, food and the emission of carbon dioxide.

title: The Mosaic Stool
description: The mosaic stool is a features a soft, wooden surface that is both comfortable and aesthetically pleasing.
